item.title: Agility handler
item.dc:creator: @Ares1 Ares_
item.description:
@Ares1 wrote:

Okay first thing is first why is this public?

public enum agilityObstacles

Make that private we do not access the data outside of the class at all?

Next thing is next like Nick said why this?

Client c;

	/*
	 * The constructor for the client
	 */
	public Agility(Client c) {
		this.c = c;
	}

We shouldn’t instance per player just because Sanity did it doesn’t mean you should too. Alright next thing.

public void handleAgility(int objectID) {

static that bitch up and make it this

public static void handleAgility(Client client, int objectID) {

Also knock it off with this kinda bullshit use the full word like conventions tell you to.

c.

always make it client. or player. etc. Anyways take this into consideration when you are fixing up your skills, this post want to offend you but to enlighten you on things you can fix and improve your code.

Read full topic

item.title: Agility handler
item.dc:creator: @strucker Strucker
item.description:
@strucker wrote:

this is no near finished its just a base for you to work with

[code=java]import server.model.players.Client;

/**

  • Handles some of agility courses, obstacles
    */
    public class Agility {

    Client c;

    /*

    • The constructor for the client
      */
      public Agility(Client c) {
      this.c = c;
      }

    public enum agilityObstacles {

     WILDERNESS_OBSTACLE_PIPE(2203, 1, 1, 1, 1, 1, 1);

 private int objectID, experience, reqLevel, emote, time, x, y;

 private agilityObstacles(int objectID, int experience, int reqLevel,
 		int emote, int time, int x, int y) {
 	this.objectID = objectID;
 	this.experience = experience;
 	this.reqLevel = reqLevel;
 	this.emote = emote;
 	this.time = time;
 	this.x = x;
 	this.y = y;
 }

    }

    public void handleAgility(int objectID) {
    for (agilityObstacles e : agilityObstacles.values()) {
    if (objectID == e.objectID) {
    if (c.playerAgility == e.reqLevel) {
    c.startAnimation(e.emote, e.time);
    c.absX = e.x;
    c.absY = e.y;
    c.getPA().addSkillXP(e.experience, c.playerAgility);
    } else {
    c.sendMessage(“You need a level of " + e.reqLevel
    + " to cross this”);
    }
    }
    }
    }

}[/code]

Read full topic
